instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no USB ports
threads.message: Hi guys, got this 2936 board with no USB. After initial troubleshooting i found J4600 had 5V on L4605 and J4610 not on L4615. On both USB mouse was not working though. Found a short to ground on <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3_RTUSB_B_ILIM</SIGNAL> so replaced <CHIP>U4600</CHIP> (5V was going in on 2/3 and out on 8 but 9 nothing), <CAPACITOR>C4617</CAPACITOR> <CAPACITOR>C4615</CAPACITOR> and L4615. After this short gone and voltage back. Now J4610 is all fine and J4600 show a light on the mouse but not working yet. Going to check datalines next but i need to figure how this works so any tips for speeding up my learning curve are welcome.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no USB ports
threads.message: Bad L4600, check continuity between pin 1-2 and 3-4

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no USB ports
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no USB ports
threads.message: <DIODE>D4600</DIODE> was loose on the board, fixed now:) thanks
